column1: Environment	"The biophysical environment is the biotic and abiotic surrounding of an organism or population
column2: and consequently includes the factors that have an influence in their survival
column4: and evolution.[1] The biophysical environment can vary in scale from microscopic to global in extent. It can also be subdivided according to its attributes. Examples include the marine environment
column5: the atmospheric environment and the terrestrial environment.[2] The number of biophysical environments is countless
column6: given that each living organism has its own environment. The term environment is often used as a short form for the biophysical environment
column7: e.g. the UK's Environment Agency. The expression the environment often refers to a singular global environment in relation to humanity."	http://ste.india.com/sites/default/files/2015/06/05/365344-en.jpg

column1: Health Care	"Health care or healthcare is the maintenance or improvement of health via the prevention
column6: and other physical and mental impairments in human beings. Healthcare is delivered by health professionals (providers or practitioners) in allied health fields. Access to health care may vary across countries
column9: largely influenced by social and economic conditions as well as the health policies in place. Countries and jurisdictions have different policies and plans in relation to the personal and population-based health care goals within their societies. Healthcare systems are organizations established to meet the health needs of targeted populations."	http://sipsoftlogic.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/healthcare-1024x410.png

column1: Gun Control		"Gun laws in the United States regulate the sale
column3: and use of firearms and ammunition. State laws (and the laws of Washington
column4: D.C. and the U.S. territories) vary considerably
column5: and are independent of existing federal firearms laws
column6: although they are sometimes broader or more limited in scope than the federal laws. State level laws vary significantly in their form
column8: and level of restriction. Forty-four states have a provision in their state constitutions similar to the Second Amendment to the U.S. Constitution
column9: which protects the right to keep and bear arms. The exceptions are California
column14: and New York. In New York
column16: the statutory civil rights laws contain a provision virtually identical to the Second Amendment."	http://www.thebluediamondgallery.com/wooden-tile/images/gun-law.jpg

column1: Election "An election is a formal group decision-making process by which a population chooses an individual to hold public office.Elections have been the usual mechanism by which modern representative democracy has operated since the 17th century. Elections may fill offices in the legislature
column2: sometimes in the executive and judiciary
column3: and for regional and local government. This process is also used in many other private and business organizations
column4: from clubs to voluntary associations and corporations." http://myedmondsnews.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/2018-Elections.png

column1: Immigrations	"Immigration is the international movement of people into a destination country of which they are not natives or where they do not possess citizenship in order to settle or reside there
column2: especially as permanent residents or naturalized citizens
column3: or to take-up employment as a migrant worker or temporarily as a foreign worker.As for economic effects
column4: research suggests that migration is beneficial both to the receiving and sending countries. Research
column6: finds that immigration on average has positive economic effects on the native population
column7: but is mixed as to whether low-skilled immigration adversely affects low-skilled natives. Studies show that the elimination of barriers to migration would have profound effects on world GDP
column8: with estimates of gains ranging between 67 and 147 percent. Development economists argue that reducing barriers to labor mobility between developing countries and developed countries would be one of the most efficient tools of poverty reduction." https://crusadernews.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/13021032_G.jpg

column2: Fox News and New York Times"	https://internetmarketingstrategiesblog.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/articles-content-featured.jpg
